item.title: Client help!? changing color with PICTURE!
item.dc:creator: @da_man1 da man1
item.description:
@da_man1 wrote:

sokolscape:

there’s so many things that say sokolscape on my client files…where would i look

Go to Client.Java-> Ctrl+f -> sokolscape
And change it to what you want. But to change that top part you must go in another file but right now I don’t know the name of it sorry. I’ll look and post it.

item.title: Client help!? changing color with PICTURE!
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

Class Gui, not EGUI.

An example from my old 377 cache client.

                                                if(theme == 1) { // Green
                                                MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new GreenTheme());
                                                } else if(theme == 2) { // Red
                                                MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new RedWTheme());
                                                } else if(theme == 3) { // Black
                                                MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new BlackTheme());
                                                MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new BlackTheme());
                                                } else if(theme == 4) { //Orange
                                                MetalLookAndFeel.setCurrentTheme(new OrangeTheme());
                                                }

To change the colour, all I had to do was chance static int theme.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help!? changing color with PICTURE!
item.dc:creator: @sokolscape sokolscape
item.description:
@sokolscape wrote:

u sure rich?

how can i tell what #s to change and what numbers to replace it with? where is the color # list?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 26, 2008, 06:12:37 pm[/size][hr]I dont have a file named GUI…but EGUI and it doesnt really have anything in it

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{

public EGUI()
{
}

public static void main(String args[])
{
    client.main(new String[] {
        "", "", ""
    });
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic
